info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 17 at 2:41AM PST until November 17 at 4:00AM PST by NWS San Francisco CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, northwestern Alameda and western Contra Costa.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oakland, Concord, Berkeley, Richmond, San Leandro, Mountain View, Alameda, San Ramon, Walnut Creek, Pittsburg, Dublin, Danville, Martinez, Pleasant Hill, San Pablo, Lafayette, El Cerrito, Castro Valley, Hercules and Albany. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING
